title: Ubuntu 20.04 - Not loading or rendering any pages
content:
My Firefox installation on Ubuntu 20.04 does not load or render any page, nothing happens when I enter an address.

I have already rebooted multiple times, purged Firefox through aptitude, deleted all files related to Firefox (profiles, the complete .mozilla folder in home, everything else) and reinstalled as suggested in various support platforms. I have started Firefox in safe mode as well.

As far as I can tell the problem started after I used "another" Firefox through my universities Citrix service to be able to access their library catalogue. I had to symbolically link all of the files in the Firefox certificate folder to that of the Citrix client for that client to work, although I've since removed those links as well and it did nothing.

I am really pulling my hairs over this as Firefox is heavily integrated in my workflow and I don't want to switch to Chrome but I also don't want to completely reinstall my laptop as that would mean completely setting up my work environment again too.
creator: koen.m.luyten

title: Firefox tabs suddenly double
content: I have configured Firefox to open eleven tabs when it launches. Intermittently, after Firefox has been open for a while, I find those eleven tabs duplicated so that I have twenty two tabs with the extra tabs in the same order as my startup tabsa. It just happened a minute ago. I have no idea what causes this to happen. I don't think it's anything I did. I'm on MacOS Big Sur 11.2.3 and Firefox 87.0. The last time it happened, I think I was on Catalina.

title: Audio interface blocking part of screen when using Spotify app
content: Recently, Firefox started to place the box you see below over my screen when I played audio. I looked up the problem and was able to disable the feature by setting media.hardwaremediakeys.enabled = false. Now audio from other tabs doesn't cause the box to appear and block the screen, however it still appears when Spotify is running. How can I stop this happening?
creator: goodriddanceblackbox

title: Secure Connection Failed  error occurred during a connection to mail.google.com. PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified...
content:
Tell me how to go back to older FF version. As it is I cannot do ANYTHING without constantly getting blocked by FF.

The security idea is great, but not if it renders connection to trusted sights impossible. I get this even from official government websites.

Unfortunately the "on" "off" dichotomy without allowing for exceptions too often results in work stoppage and work arounds.

You are simply too early with the security demands and FF users NEED to be able to have an exception list until such time as the security implementations are universal.

If I constantly have to switch to edge as I have had to, I might as well bury Firefox and use edge. This is sad for someone who goes back to Netscape & early Firefox

I'll thank you when you fix the allow exceptions in FF or when websites have "caught up" with website accessibility issues.

Bert Davich
creator: bertdavich

creator: Ari94

title: Sync. Please stop or at least prompt!
content:
I don't want to sync work and home browsing. So I do not log in to Firefox at home. A few days ago, I checked my worke webmail which is a GSuite account. Firefox recognized my login and this morning synced my browsing history.

Normally I have up to 60 tabs open and I leave the browser on all the time. Nice and simple to check in on all the things that interest me or things I want to come back to.

You got it, This morning, all my open tabs are gone. All my local history is gone. I now have a shortcut menu bar full of links to work resources that I can't even access as they are behind the work firewall.

Could there not have been a backup made of what I had open? Does it not make sense that if there are tabs open it is not up to FF to decide to close them? Could there not have been a prompt that asked "Hey we want to sync." "This will close all your open tabs" "Is this OK?" Look, I know you want to make it simple and convenient, but please don't assume you know what that means to everyone. You ruined my day, not made it simple or better. Sincerely, kkrofft
creator: kkrofft

title: Firefox stop straming radio on Raspberry PI - works with Chrome
content:
Hello,

I have a Raspberry PI with 4GB of memory and I listen to my radio station Jazzfm.com all day. The problem with Firefox is that once in a while the stream just stops for 10-30 seconds and resumes. I never encounter this problem with Chrome. I tried disabling Performance acceleration - it doesn't help. Sometimes the stream works for hours and then it stops and resumes a couple of times.

I usually have one tab open with the radio stream, others tabs with news, etc. How can I fix this problem?

As I say, Chrome - never an issue, I can stream all day with any interruptions and it's not my broadband, as I am on a Superfast fibre. Does this have something to do with Firefox prioritizing the other tabs? Can I somehow monitor this by launching Firefox from the console to grab any errors?

Thanks, Richard
creator: richlion2

title: One-click search engines are no more "one-click"
content:
Hi there. As we know, when you start typing anything in the search bar, at the bottom of it Firefox displays icons of different search engines, like Google, Wikipedia or IMDB.

In previous versions of Firefox, after typing a word in the search bar, I only had to click once on the search bar icon (for example Wikipedia), and Firefox was automatically loading the website I clicked at, with search results. However in the past 3-4 weeks (after one of the updates) it has changed. Now, when I type the word in the search bar and then I click at a certain search engine icon, Firefox does not automatically move me to this search engine's website - I have to press Enter to load this website. So actually it is necessary to make to clicks - one on the icon, and second one the "Enter" to start the searching.

I know it is a trivial problem and it takes only one moment to press "Enter", however I got used so much to clicking on icon only to start the searching, that after few weeks it still triggers me that I need to additionally press another button :) Can someone help with that, or is it normal now in Firefox?
